news.title: PM to inaugurate Bengaluru's yellow line metro on August 10
news.para: Narendra Modi, the Prime Minister, is set to visit Bengaluru on August 10. He will inaugurate the Yellow Line Metro. This project aims to ease traffic congestion. The Prime Minister will also initiate Metro Phase-3. This phase received quick approval. These projects are expected to benefit many commuters. The Yellow Line is expected to be operational by August 15.

news.title: Allahabad HC directs Ghaziabad development body to maintain status quo on demolition notice
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has ordered a status quo on demolition notices issued by the Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) concerning alleged illegal properties on public land. The court has directed the district administration and GDA to present a rehabilitation plan for the long-term inhabitants, many from weaker sections, who have occupied the land for 40-50 years.

news.title: Bengaluru: E-khata data entry error lands owner huge tax bill
news.para: As per the sale deed, the built-up area is 1366 sq ft and the car parking area is 180 sq ft. However, the staff at BangaloreOne, despite undergoing a week-long training as claimed by the BBMP Chief Commissioner, mistakenly entered both the built-up area and car parking area as 1366 sq ft, resulting in an inaccurate property record.

news.title: Odisha governor asks real estate developers to invest in tier II & III cities
news.para: Odisha Governor urges real estate developers to invest in tier II and III cities for balanced urbanisation and sustainable development, emphasising ethical practices. Credai highlighted Bhubaneswar's emergence as a dynamic tri-city cluster with Cuttack and Puri, poised to be among India's top 50 urban centres. The real estate sector's significant contribution to India's GDP and employment generation was also underscored.

news.title: JSW Cement cuts IPO size to ₹3,600 crore; public offer to open on August 7
news.para: JSW Cement will launch its initial public offering on August 7. The IPO size is Rs 3,600 crore. It is lower than the previously planned Rs 4,000 crore. The IPO includes a fresh issue and an offer for sale. Apollo Management and SBI will offload shares. The company will use the funds for a new cement unit and debt repayment.

news.title: Nashik civic body collects 41% property tax in four months
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation collected Rs 111 crore in property tax between April and July. This is 41% of the Rs 275 crore target for fiscal year 2025-26. A rebate program encouraged taxpayers. An 8% rebate was given for full payments made early. The NMC also provided an extra 1% concession for online payments.

news.title: Ujjain IT Park to get an expansion with phase II
news.para: The IT Park in Ujjain is expanding into a second phase on 1.5 acres, driven by high demand from tech firms. MPIDC has appointed a developer for the Rs 50 crore project, aiming to create a robust ecosystem for IT and startups. Phase one, expected to complete by December 2026, has already attracted interest from 20 companies.

news.title: In Chandigarh, property tax cases worth ₹62 crore under litigation in HC
news.para: The Municipal Corporation Chandigarh faces a challenge in recovering over Rs 190 crore from the top 20 property tax defaulters. Approximately Rs 62 crore in property tax arrears are currently under litigation in the Punjab and Haryana High Court. Disputes over land and area assessments are the primary reasons for the legal challenges, hindering the MC's recovery efforts.

news.title: Secunderabad cantonment board to disconnect water supply of six crore defaulters
news.para: Secunderabad Cantonment Board will disconnect water supply. This action is for residents with unpaid bills. The board is owed approximately 6 crore. Many residents have not paid since February 2022. Some owe more than 10 lakh. The board has already disconnected 33 lines.

news.title: Brookfield India REIT posts 13% growth in NOI in Q1 FY26, plans ₹1,000 crore fund raise
news.para: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust (BIRET) reported a 13% year-on-year increase in net operating income, reaching ₹4,986 million for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The REIT achieved significant leasing and occupancy growth, leading to a 17% year-on-year rise in distribution to ₹5.25 per unit.

news.title: Deadline for property tax settlement scheme extended to Aug 15 in Ludhiana
news.para: Ludhiana residents get extended relief as the local bodies department pushes the property tax settlement scheme deadline to August 15. This offers defaulters a chance to clear dues from 2013-14 without interest or penalties. The scheme has already boosted revenue, collecting ₹15 crore, contributing to the ₹40 crore property tax revenue for the current fiscal year.

news.title: Only 29% of plots sold under Andhra Pradesh's MIG housing initiative
news.para: Andhra Pradesh's 'Smart Townships' scheme, aimed at providing affordable plots for middle-income groups, faces challenges with low sales, achieving only 29% plot sales and 23% of projected revenue. Structural issues like income caps, lottery allocation, and pricing have hindered its success. The government is now revising its approach, considering commercial auctions and layout modifications to improve the scheme's viability.

news.title: Optum leases office space in Chennai’s Embassy Splendid Tech Zone for GCC
news.para: Optum Global Solutions has leased 500,000 sq ft in Chennai’s Embassy Splendid Tech Zone for a new Global Capability Centre, set to open by Q3 2025. This major deal expands Optum’s India footprint and highlights Chennai’s growing appeal for tech-driven GCCs. India continues to lead globally in GCC presence, driven by talent, cost efficiency, and strategic value creation.

news.title: ED files additional chargesheet on 1,700-acre lands in PMC-HDIL case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has filed another chargesheet in the PMC Bank fraud case. This involves land in Sindhudurg, already seized by the ED. Rakesh Wadhawan and Sarang Wadhawan allegedly used defrauded money to buy land in the names of employees. They planned to sell it for the Vijay Durg port project. The state government wants to develop the port.

news.title: DTCP razes illegal structure in Emaar Palm Hills over layout plan violation in Gurugram
news.para: The DTCP demolished an illegal meeting hall built by the EMAAR Palm Hills RWA in Sector 77, as it violated the approved layout plan by encroaching on a common open area. The department warned RWAs against unauthorized construction on green belts or common areas, clarifying their role is limited to maintenance, not new construction.

news.title: Rising construction costs hinder progress of PMAY-G scheme in Mysuru and Chamarajanagar
news.para: The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin (PMAY-G) in Mysuru and Chamarajanagar faces delays due to rising construction costs. Mysuru achieved 64.4% progress against its target of 20,908 houses, while Chamarajanagar lags at 27.2%. Beneficiaries struggle with existing grants of Rs 1.2 lakh and Rs 1.8 lakh, prompting calls for increased financial assistance to complete construction.

news.title: Bengaluru civic body fines builder, sacks officials over footpath ramp encroachment
news.para: Bengaluru civic body penalises builder Rs.1 lakh, removes three officials for ignoring footpath encroachment, debris complaints, and public safety violations Acting on complaints, BBMP officials inspected the site and confirmed the encroachment.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body to file fresh FIR against Ansal Properties for basement cave-in
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority is preparing to file another FIR against Ansal Properties after a cave-in at Sushant Aquapolis Integrated Township caused vehicles to be submerged. The incident revealed infrastructural deficiencies, including the lack of fencing around a basement, leading to flooding and a 15ft crater.

news.title: SC hearing next week, Sports City builders start repaying their dues
news.para: Noida Authority is recovering dues from developers of Sports City projects following High Court orders. Lotus Green Constructions paid ₹80 crore, with others expected to follow. Notices were issued to 62 developers for ₹11,000 crore in dues. The court has ordered CBI and ED investigations into irregularities, while developers have approached the Supreme Court.

news.title: Haryana RERA orders builder to refund amount with 11% interest in restaurant unit dispute
news.para: Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority addressed a dispute between Atombridge Networks and Neo Developers. Atombridge sought to restore a cancelled restaurant unit booking in Sector 109. H-Rera validated the cancellation due to the absence of a builder-buyer agreement. However, Neo Developers must refund Rs 42.5 lakh to Atombridge. A deduction of 10% as earnest money applies.
